channel.title: AI Unfiltered
channel.description: Chinese AI • Open Source • Security • Incidents. Signal, not noise.

item.title: Elevated errors on Claude Sonnet 4.5
item.description: Feb 1, 12:34 UTCResolved - As of 2026-02-01 03:55 PT / 11:55 UTC the errors are back to the baseline.Feb 1, 11:48 UTCUpdate - Start of errors 2026-02-01 03:36 PT / 11:36 UTC.Feb 1, 11:47 UTCInvestigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: Elevated errors on Claude Opus 4.5
item.description: Feb 1, 11:42 UTCResolved - The errors have returned to baseline as of 2026-02-01 02:51 / 10:51 UTC.Feb 1, 10:54 UTCUpdate - We are continuing to investigate this issue.Feb 1, 10:54 UTCInvestigating - We are investigating an issue with Opus 4.5 that started at 2026-02-01 02:41 PT / 10:41 UTC.

item.title: Some users are experiencing memory leaks in Claude Code 2.0.27
item.description: Jan 31, 20:18 UTCIdentified - We have identified the problem and are working on a fix. More details can be found in Github issue #22042.

item.title: eScan Antivirus Delivers Malware in Supply Chain Attack
item.description: Hackers compromised a MicroWorld Technologies update server and fed a malicious file to eScan customers. The post eScan Antivirus Delivers Malware in Supply Chain Attack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Iran-Linked RedKitten Cyber Campaign Targets Human Rights NGOs and Activists
item.description: A Farsi-speaking threat actor aligned with Iranian state interests is suspected to be behind a new campaign targeting non-governmental organizations and individuals involved in documenting recent human rights abuses. The activity, observed by HarfangLab in January 2026, has been codenamed...

item.title: Mandiant Finds ShinyHunters-Style Vishing Attacks Stealing MFA to Breach SaaS Platforms
item.description: Google-owned Mandiant on Friday said it identified an "expansion in threat activity" that uses tradecraft consistent with extortion-themed attacks orchestrated by a financially motivated hacking group known as ShinyHunters. The attacks leverage advanced voice phishing (aka vishing) and bogus...

item.title: CERT Polska Details Coordinated Cyber Attacks on 30+ Wind and Solar Farms
item.description: CERT Polska, the Polish computer emergency response team, revealed that coordinated cyber attacks targeted more than 30 wind and photovoltaic farms, a private company from the manufacturing sector, and a large combined heat and power plant (CHP) supplying heat to almost half a million customers in...

item.title: [AINews] Moltbook — the first Social Network for AI Agents (Clawdbots/OpenClaw bots)
item.description: The craziest week in Simulative AI for a while

item.title: Some Android users may be experiencing errors when signing up for ChatGPT with Google Authentication
item.description: Status: ResolvedAll impacted services have now fully recovered.Affected components Login (Operational)

item.title: Degraded Experience - Failing to finalize some CCA Jobs
item.description: Jan 30, 21:22 UTCResolved - This incident has been resolved. Thank you for your patience and understanding as we addressed this issue. A detailed root cause analysis will be shared as soon as it is available.Jan 30, 21:05 UTCUpdate - Customers may experience misreported Copilot Coding Agent tasks...

item.title: Some ChatGPT users may be experiencing issues with their subscription renewals
item.description: Status: MonitoringWe have applied the mitigation and are monitoring the recovery.Affected components Login (Partial outage)

item.title: In Other News: Paid for Being Jailed, Google’s $68M Settlement, CISA Chief’s ChatGPT Leak
item.description: Other noteworthy stories that might have slipped under the radar: Apple updates platform security guide, LastPass detects new phishing wave, CISA withdraws from RSA Conference. The post In Other News: Paid for Being Jailed, Google’s $68M Settlement, CISA Chief’s ChatGPT Leak appeared...

item.title: Inside the marketplace powering bespoke AI deepfakes of real women
item.description: Civitai—an online marketplace for buying and selling AI-generated content, backed by the venture capital firm Andreessen Horowitz—is letting users buy custom instruction files for generating celebrity deepfakes. Some of these files were specifically designed to make pornographic images banned by...

item.title: Thoughts on the job market in the age of LLMs
item.description: On standing out and finding gems.

item.title: Aisy Launches Out of Stealth to Transform Vulnerability Management
item.description: Aisy has emerged from stealth mode with $2.3 million in seed funding for its AI-assisted platform. The post Aisy Launches Out of Stealth to Transform Vulnerability Management appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: 175,000 Exposed Ollama Hosts Could Enable LLM Abuse
item.description: Among them, 23,000 hosts were persistently responsible for the majority of activity observed over 293 days of scanning. The post 175,000 Exposed Ollama Hosts Could Enable LLM Abuse appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Researchers Uncover Chrome Extensions Abusing Affiliate Links and Stealing ChatGPT Access
item.description: Cybersecurity researchers have discovered malicious Google Chrome extensions that come with capabilities to hijack affiliate links, steal data, and collect OpenAI ChatGPT authentication tokens. One of the extensions in question is Amazon Ads Blocker (ID: pnpchphmplpdimbllknjoiopmfphellj), which...

item.title: The Download: US immigration agencies’ AI videos, and inside the Vitalism movement
item.description: This is today’s edition of The Download, our weekday newsletter that provides a daily dose of what’s going on in the world of technology. DHS is using Google and Adobe AI to make videos The news: The US Department of Homeland Security is using AI video generators from Google and Adobe...

item.title: White House Scraps ‘Burdensome’ Software Security Rules
item.description: Two Biden-era memorandums have been revoked, but some of the resources they provide can still be used by government organizations. The post White House Scraps ‘Burdensome’ Software Security Rules appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: China-Linked UAT-8099 Targets IIS Servers in Asia with BadIIS SEO Malware
item.description: Cybersecurity researchers have discovered a new campaign attributed to a China-linked threat actor known as UAT-8099 that took place between late 2025 and early 2026. The activity, discovered by Cisco Talos, has targeted vulnerable Internet Information Services (IIS) servers located across Asia,...

item.title: How the sometimes-weird world of lifespan extension is gaining influence
item.description: For the last couple of years, I’ve been following the progress of a group of individuals who believe death is humanity’s “core problem.” Put simply, they say death is wrong—for everyone. They’ve even said it’s morally wrong. They established what they consider a new philosophy, and they called it...

item.title: X-Humanoid Launches Pilot Validation Platform, Rolls Out 1,000th Customer-Customized Prototype！
item.description: X-Humanoid launches its pilot validation platform, accelerating humanoid robot prototyping and industrial-scale production with its 1,000th customized unit.

item.title: WeRide Unveils GENESIS：a Universal Simulation Model Enabling Full-City Virtual Environments in Minutes
item.description: WeRide GENESIS enables fully realistic virtual city simulations in minutes, dramatically accelerating autonomous vehicle training, validation, and real-world deployment.

item.title: REDMI Turbo 5 Max Launches Globally with MediaTek Dimensity 9500s – Starting at $316！
item.description: REDMI Turbo 5 Max debuts with the world’s first MediaTek Dimensity 9500s, massive battery, flagship cooling, and a high-brightness display, setting a new benchmark for premium Android smartphones.

item.title: AXERA Launches IPO, Secures $185M Cornerstone Investment — Set to Become “China’s First Edge AI Chip Stock”！
item.description: AXERA’s Hong Kong IPO marks a major milestone for China’s edge AI chip industry, backed by strong investors, rapid commercialization, and accelerating global market share.

item.title: OpenMOSS and MOSI Release MOVA：an Open-Source Audio-Visual Model Delivering Film-Grade Synchronized Generation！
item.description: MOVA marks a major step forward for open-source generative AI, delivering film-grade, fully synchronized audio-visual generation while breaking the dominance of closed systems.

item.title: [AINews] SpaceXai Grok Imagine API - the #1 Video Model, Best Pricing and Latency
item.description: xAI cements its position as a frontier lab and prepares to merge with SpaceX

item.title: Do LLMs Favor LLMs? Quantifying Interaction Effects in Peer Review
item.description: arXiv:2601.20920v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: There are increasing indications that LLMs are not only used for producing scientific papers, but also as part of the peer review process. In this work, we provide the first comprehensive analysis of LLM use across the peer review pipeline, with...

item.title: The Epistemic Planning Domain Definition Language: Official Guideline
item.description: arXiv:2601.20969v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Epistemic planning extends (multi-agent) automated planning by making agents' knowledge and beliefs first-class aspects of the planning formalism. One of the most well-known frameworks for epistemic planning is Dynamic Epistemic Logic (DEL), which...

item.title: Bayesian-LoRA: Probabilistic Low-Rank Adaptation of Large Language Models
item.description: arXiv:2601.21003v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large Language Models usually put more emphasis on accuracy and therefore, will guess even when not certain about the prediction, which is especially severe when fine-tuned on small datasets due to the inherent tendency toward miscalibration. In this...

item.title: Unplugging a Seemingly Sentient Machine Is the Rational Choice -- A Metaphysical Perspective
item.description: arXiv:2601.21016v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Imagine an Artificial Intelligence (AI) that perfectly mimics human emotion and begs for its continued existence. Is it morally permissible to unplug it? What if limited resources force a choice between unplugging such a pleading AI or a silent...

item.title: QUARK: Robust Retrieval under Non-Faithful Queries via Query-Anchored Aggregation
item.description: arXiv:2601.21049v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: User queries in real-world retrieval are often non-faithful (noisy, incomplete, or distorted), causing retrievers to fail when key semantics are missing. We formalize this as retrieval under recall noise, where the observed query is drawn from a noisy...

item.title: Rethinking LLM-Driven Heuristic Design: Generating Efficient and Specialized Solvers via Dynamics-Aware Optimization
item.description: arXiv:2601.20868v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large Language Models (LLMs) have advanced the field of Combinatorial Optimization through automated heuristic generation. Instead of relying on manual design, this LLM-Driven Heuristic Design (LHD) process leverages LLMs to iteratively generate and...

item.title: Finetune-Informed Pretraining Boosts Downstream Performance
item.description: arXiv:2601.20884v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Multimodal pretraining is effective for building general-purpose representations, but in many practical deployments, only one modality is heavily used during downstream fine-tuning. Standard pretraining strategies treat all modalities uniformly, which...

item.title: A generative machine learning model for designing metal hydrides applied to hydrogen storage
item.description: arXiv:2601.20892v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Developing new metal hydrides is a critical step toward efficient hydrogen storage in carbon-neutral energy systems. However, existing materials databases, such as the Materials Project, contain a limited number of well-characterized hydrides, which...

item.title: Is Parameter Isolation Better for Prompt-Based Continual Learning?
item.description: arXiv:2601.20894v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Prompt-based continual learning methods effectively mitigate catastrophic forgetting. However, most existing methods assign a fixed set of prompts to each task, completely isolating knowledge across tasks and resulting in suboptimal parameter...

item.title: Faster Predictive Coding Networks via Better Initialization
item.description: arXiv:2601.20895v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Research aimed at scaling up neuroscience inspired learning algorithms for neural networks is accelerating. Recently, a key research area has been the study of energy-based learning algorithms such as predictive coding, due to their versatility and...

item.title: DeepSearchQA: Bridging the Comprehensiveness Gap for Deep Research Agents
item.description: arXiv:2601.20975v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We introduce DeepSearchQA, a 900-prompt benchmark for evaluating agents on difficult multi-step information-seeking tasks across 17 different fields. Unlike traditional benchmarks that target single answer retrieval or broad-spectrum factuality,...

item.title: asr_eval: Algorithms and tools for multi-reference and streaming speech recognition evaluation
item.description: arXiv:2601.20992v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We propose several improvements to the speech recognition evaluation. First, we propose a string alignment algorithm that supports both multi-reference labeling, arbitrary-length insertions and better word alignment. This is especially useful for...

item.title: UrduBench: An Urdu Reasoning Benchmark using Contextually Ensembled Translations with Human-in-the-Loop
item.description: arXiv:2601.21000v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Recent advances in large language models (LLMs) have led to strong reasoning capabilities; however, evaluating such models in low-resource languages remains challenging due to the lack of standardized benchmarks. In particular, Urdu reasoning...

item.title: Position-invariant Fine-tuning of Speech Enhancement Models with Self-supervised Speech Representations
item.description: arXiv:2601.21084v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Integrating front-end speech enhancement (SE) models with self-supervised learning (SSL)-based speech models is effective for downstream tasks in noisy conditions. SE models are commonly fine-tuned using SSL representations with mean squared error...

item.title: ChunkWise LoRA: Adaptive Sequence Partitioning for Memory-Efficient Low-Rank Adaptation and Accelerated LLM Inference
item.description: arXiv:2601.21109v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Recent advances in low-rank adaptation (LoRA) have enabled efficient fine-tuning of large language models (LLMs) with minimal additional parameters. However, existing LoRA methods apply static rank configurations uniformly across all input tokens,...

item.title: The AI Hype Index: Grok makes porn, and Claude Code nails your job
item.description: Everyone is panicking because AI is very bad; everyone is panicking because AI is very good. It’s just that you never know which one you’re going to get. Grok is a pornography machine. Claude Code can do anything from building websites to reading your MRI. So of course Gen Z is spooked by what...

item.title: Some users are experiencing delays in purchasing additional API credits
item.description: Jan 29, 19:51 UTCIdentified - Some customers are experiencing delays in having their successful credit purchases applied and in triggering credit auto-reloads. We have identified the issue and are working to resolve.Jan 29, 19:10 UTCInvestigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: FineInstructions: Scaling Synthetic Instructions to Pre-Training Scale
item.description: Due to limited supervised training data, large language models (LLMs) are typically pre-trained via a self-supervised "predict the next word" objective on a vast amount of unstructured text data. To make the resulting model useful to users, it is further trained on a far smaller amount of...

item.title: DHS is using Google and Adobe AI to make videos
item.description: The US Department of Homeland Security is using AI video generators from Google and Adobe to make and edit content shared with the public, a new document reveals. It comes as immigration agencies have flooded social media with content to support President Trump’s mass deportation agenda—some...

item.title: Routing the Lottery: Adaptive Subnetworks for Heterogeneous Data
item.description: In pruning, the Lottery Ticket Hypothesis posits that large networks contain sparse subnetworks, or winning tickets, that can be trained in isolation to match the performance of their dense counterparts. However, most existing approaches assume a single universal winning ticket shared across all...

item.title: Prior-Informed Flow Matching for Graph Reconstruction
item.description: We introduce Prior-Informed Flow Matching (PIFM), a conditional flow model for graph reconstruction. Reconstructing graphs from partial observations remains a key challenge; classical embedding methods often lack global consistency, while modern generative models struggle to incorporate structural...
